svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This sequence is a base class for all barier based sequences. This sequence cannot be run as such, but contains methods which are used by other barrier sequences

NOTE: Continuous polling may need adding interval between two consecutive transactions. See poll_barrier_flag_and_check_post_barrier_contents task for details.

  function svt_axi_ace_master_base_sequence
 svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence::create_post_barrier_load_seq
 (  int length , int port_id , int readonce_wt , int readshared_wt , int readnotshareddirty_wt , int readclean_wt  ) 

Creates a poast barrier sequence to load (read)

length - The number of pre barrier transactions required

port_id - The port_id on which these pre barrier transactions will be executed

readonce_wt - The weightage for a READONCE transaction

readshared_wt - The weightage for a READSHARED transaction

readnotshareddirty_wt - The weightage for a READNOTSHAREDDIRTY transaction

readclean_wt - The weightage for a READCLEAN transaction

length - The number of pre barrier transactions required

readclean_wt - The weightage for a READCLEAN transaction

  function svt_axi_ace_master_base_sequence

 (  int length , int port_id , int makeunique_wt , int readunique_wt , int writelineunique_wt , int writeunique_wt  ) 

Creates a pre barrier sequence to store (write)

length - The number of pre barrier transactions required

port_id - The port_id on which these pre barrier transactions will be executed

makeunique_wt - The weightage for a MAKEUNIQUE transaction

readunique_wt - The weightage for a READUNIQUE transaction

writelineunique_wt - The weightage for a WRITELINEUNIQUE_wt transaction

writeunique_wt - The weightage for a WRITEUNIQUE_wt transaction

  task
 svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence::poll_barrier_flag_and_check_post_barrier_contents
 (  int port_id , svt_axi_ace_master_base_sequence post_barrier_read_seq , svt_axi_master_transaction pre_barrier_xacts [$], svt_axi_master_transaction barrier_flag_xact  ) 

This task continuosly reads from port_id, the location written through barrier_flag_xact When the value returned is equal to the post barrier flag xact, the loop terminates and all locations written through the pre barrier transactions (given in pre_barrier_xacts) are read back using post_barrier_read_seq. The locations read back are checked for data consistency to ensure that all the pre barrier barrier transactions are observed correctly.

port_id - The port from which the flag set through barrier_flag_xact is to be read The same port_id is used to send post_barrier_read_seq

post_barrier_read_seq - The sequence to be used to read all the location written through pre_barrier_xacts

pre_barrier_xacts - The pre barrier store transactions that need to be read back

barrier_flag_xact - The transaction used as a flag to indicate that all the pre-barrier transactions are observable to any transaction that can observe the flag

NOTE: Continuous polling may need adding interval between two consecutive transactions Interconnect can enter into deadlock condition if master sends continuous transactions without any gap in between two consecutive transactions targeted to a particular address. CCI400 has this restriction where if a hazarded address is polled continuously then other pending transaction issued by other master sent to the same address never gets selected to proceed further and remains in hang state. System Configuration parameter ic_num_cycles_interval_for_polling_hazarded_address can be used to introduce interval in polling in terms of number of cycles.

  task
 svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence::send_barrier_sequence
 (  int port_id , svt_axi_ace_master_base_sequence pre_barrier_seq , output svt_axi_master_transaction pre_barrier_xacts [$], output svt_axi_ace_barrier_pair_sequence barrier_pair_seq  ) 

Sends a barrier sequences that consists of Pre barrier transactions as given in pre_barrier_seq A barrier pair (WRITEBARRIER and READBARRIER)

pre_barrier_seq - Handle to pre barrier sequence

  task
 svt_axi_ace_master_barrier_base_virtual_sequence::send_post_barrier_xact
 (  int port_id , svt_axi_master_transaction write_barrier_xact , svt_axi_master_transaction read_barrier_xact , bit is_single_byte_flag_xact , output svt_axi_master_transaction post_barrier_xact  ) 

Creates a post barrier transaction by associating it with the given write and read barriers. The post barrier transaction is a WRITEUNIQUE transaction that addresses a single byte.

port_id - The port on which the post barrier must be sent

write_barrier_xact - The WRITE barrier transaction to which to associate the post barrier

read_barrier_xact - The READ barrier transaction to which to associate the post barrier

is_single_byte_flag_xact - Indicates if the post barrier should be a transaction that addresses a single byte. This is currently always single byte irrespective of what is passed here

post_barrier_xact - The output post_barrier transaction
